trans-unit.source: To use Visual Studio Code for Azure development, you'll need to install Visual Studio Code locally and one or more Azure extensions.
In this exercise, we'll add the **Azure App Service** extension.
Install Visual Studio Code
Windows
[Download the Visual Studio Code installer for Windows](https://code.visualstudio.com/).
Run the installer.
Open Visual Studio Code by pressing the Windows key or clicking the Windows icon on the task bar, typing "Visual Studio Code" and clicking on the **Visual Studio Code** result.
macOS
[Download Visual Studio Code for macOS](https://code.visualstudio.com/).
Double-click on the downloaded archive to expand the contents.
Drag Visual Studio Code.app to the Applications folder.
Open Visual Studio Code by clicking on the icon the Apps section or by searching for Visual Studio Code in Spotlight.

Install Azure App Service extension
If you haven't already, open Visual Studio Code.
Open the Extensions browser; it's accessed via the menu on the left.
Search for **Azure App Service**.
Select the **Azure App Service** result and click **Install**.
The following screenshot shows the Azure App Service extension selected from the Visual Studio Code extension search results.

You're now ready to connect to your Azure subscription and deploy a web, mobile, or API app to an Azure App Service.
